intro: Corallocarpus dissectus, commonly known as the dissected corallocarpus, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves with deeply lobed margins. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
